title.narrative: QUALITY:LEARNING

description.narrative: More girls and boys, including the most marginalized in targeted areas benefit from improved quality of learning in an inclusive environment, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Operations Support To Programme Delivery. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: All children have improved access to quality inclusive education, from early learning to secondary education, particularly those who are most marginalized

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: More girls and boys, including the most marginalized in targeted areas benefit from improved quality of learning in aninclusive environment

description.narrative: UNICEF provided support in strengthening the quality of learning through competency-based approach in education, targeting revision of the curriculum, teacher professional development and in-classroom support system, and reforming of the assessment system. Ongoing development of national policy documents on learning assessment and inclusive education, along with competency-based career counselling represent emerging areas for further upstream engagement. The scaling up of UNICEF supported interventions are being mainstreamed in these strategic documents, leveraging opportunities for increased quality of learning in the country. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:20/01/2022
